title: Workers for slaughterhouse cleaning firm that hired children repeatedly used stolen identities to get jobs
description: Workers for PSSI, which hired over 100 children to clean slaughterhouses, repeatedly used stolen identities to get jobs, say ex-managers and people who told NBC News their identities were stolen.

title: San Francisco DA blasts Elon Musk over reaction to stabbing death
description: District Attorney Brooke Jenkins said that Musk had been reckless when he suggested within hours of the killing that “repeat violent offenders” were involved.

title: Texas county will keep library system open and comply with judge's order to put banned books back in circulation
description: LLANO, Texas — A small-town Texas library system threatened with extinction was spared Thursday after the Llano County commissioners said they would abide by a federal judge's order to restore the books they banned rather than shut the system down.

title: Residents near Indiana plastics fire report snow-like debris falling and a taste of chemicals in the air
description: Some debris from a giant fire at a plastics recycling plant in Indiana contains asbestos, officials said Thursday, as firefighters gained control of the blaze.

title: Human rights groups come out against potential TikTok ban, citing free speech concerns
description: Leading human rights groups including Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International have long been critical of the Chinese government and its policies.

title: Florida's Legislature passes a 6-week abortion ban
description: Florida’s Republican-dominated Legislature on Friday passed a ban on most abortions after six weeks, sending the highly controversial bill to Gov. Ron DeSantis.

title: Supreme Court allows $6 billion student loan debt settlement
description: A settlement that will allow thousands of student loan debts to be canceled will go into effect after the Supreme Court on Thursday declined to block it.

title: Wife of Florida drag ban sponsor to host 'sultry' performance to benefit kids' charity
description: Florida Rep. Randy Fine, a Republican, on Wednesday fervently defended a bill he’s sponsoring to criminalize “adult live performances” in front of children.

title: Montana close to becoming 1st state to completely ban TikTok
description: Montana lawmakers were expected to take a big step forward Thursday on a bill to ban TikTok from operating in the state, a move that’s bound to face legal challenges but also serve as a testing ground for the TikTok-free America that many national lawmakers have envisioned.

title: Amazon jumps into the generative A.I. race with new cloud service
description: Amazon is introducing a cloud service called Bedrock that developers can use to enhance their software with artificial intelligence systems.

title: Against a backdrop of mass shootings, GOP hopefuls flock to the NRA convention
description: Republicans competing for the 2024 GOP presidential nomination are set to address this weekend's annual National Rifle Association convention.

title: Louisville bank shooter was seeing counselor for depression and anxiety, family spokesperson says
description: The Louisville bank shooter who killed five and injured eight was seeing a counselor for depression and anxiety, a family friend said Thursday.

title: U.S. officials identify leaked classified documents suspect as 21-year-old Air National Guardsman
description: The person suspected of recently leaking classified U.S. government documents has been identified as Jack Teixeira, a 21-year-old member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard, two law enforcement officials said Thursday.

title: Appeals court refuses to decide if Trump can be shielded from rape accuser's defamation suit
description: A Washington, D.C., appeals court refused to decide whether Donald Trump can be shielded from a defamation suit by E. Jean Carroll, who alleges Trump raped her.

title: San Francisco police arrest suspect in killing of tech exec Bob Lee, city official says
description: San Francisco police on Thursday arrested a suspect in the fatal stabbing of technology executive Bob Lee, the president of the city's Board of Supervisors said.

title: Former Nickelodeon star Drake Bell reported missing in Florida, police say
description: Former Nickelodeon star Drake Bell was reported missing and is considered "endangered," police in Florida said Thursday.

title: Videos of high school life in decades past stir nostalgia and debate
description: A grainy video that recently circulated on social media captured a mundane portrait of school life at the turn of the new millennium.

title: Ex-Capitol Police officer sentenced after sending 'stupid and reckless' messages to Jan. 6 rioter
description: Retired U.S. Capitol Police officer Michael Riley, who told a Jan. 6 rioter to delete posts about storming the Capitol, was sentenced on Thursday.

title: Biden says he's concerned about intel leak and DOJ probe into leaker is 'getting close'
description: President Joe Biden on Thursday said he is “concerned” by the leak of classified U.S. documents and that a probe into the leak is "getting close" to a conclusion.

title: Jury selection to begin in Fox News defamation lawsuit
description: Jury selection is expected to get underway in the $1.6 billion defamation lawsuit against Fox News over alleged conspiracy theories the network pushed about Dominion Voting Systems following the 2020 election. NBC News’ Jane Timm explains what to expect from the high-stakes trial.

title: Homeward bound: Lost dog returns home after surviving epic 150-mile journey across Alaskan sea ice
description: A 1-year-old Australian shepherd took an epic trek across 150 miles of frozen Bering Sea ice that included being bitten by a seal or polar bear before he was safely returned to his home in Alaska.

title: Trump to be deposed in New York AG's business fraud lawsuit
description: Former President Donald Trump is scheduled to be deposed Thursday in Attorney General Letitia James' $250 million civil suit alleging fraud in Trump's business practices.

title: How much is an early presidential primary worth? Georgia Democrats hope $1 billion
description: An early presidential primary could add $1.12 billion to Georgia’s economy, according to a new economic impact report that's being touted by Democrats.

title: Jury selection begins in the Dominion defamation case against Fox News
description: Jury selection in the Dominion Voting Systems defamation case is set to begin Thursday morning in the case against Fox News and Fox Corp.

title: 1 dead, 2 teens injured after shooting near Northwestern University; suspects fled the scene
description: A man was killed and two teenagers were injured, after a shooting that prompted officials at Northwestern University to order students and faculty to shelter-in-place as police searched for suspects.

title: Appeals court partially blocks ruling that imperils access to key abortion pill
description: A federal appeals court late on Wednesday blocked part of a ruling issued last week by a Trump-appointed judge that endangers access to the abortion pill mifepristone.

title: Lori Vallow trial: Who are the key players in the murder case?
description: Lori Vallow’s murder trial is underway, a complicated case in which she is accused of killing two of her children and her estranged husband and conspiring to kill her current husband’s late wife.

title: South Florida is pounded by heavy rain as more than a foot falls in some areas
description: A heavy downpour flooded roads in Florida and halted flights at Fort Lauderdale’s airport, as storms dumped as much as 14 inches of rain in the area.
